step_by_step_implementation.title: Tree Search Planner
step_by_step_implementation.description: Implement depth-limited tree search for discrete actions
step_by_step_implementation.code_snippet:
class TreeSearchPlanner:
    def __init__(self, model, max_depth=10, branching_factor=5):
        self.model = model
        self.max_depth = max_depth
        self.branching_factor = branching_factor
        
    def plan(self, current_belief, goal_state=None):
        # Root node
        root = Node(state=current_belief, depth=0)
        
        # Expand tree using breadth-first or depth-first
        frontier = [root]
        best_policy = None
        best_G = float('inf')
        
        while frontier:
            node = frontier.pop(0)
            
            if node.depth >= self.max_depth:
                continue
                
            # Generate child nodes for different actions
            for action in self.get_actions(node.state):
                child_state = self.model.transition(node.state, action)
                child_obs = self.model.observation(child_state)
                
                # Update beliefs
                child_belief = self.model.update_belief(node.state, action, child_obs)
                
                # Compute expected free energy
                G = self.expected_free_energy(child_belief, goal_state)
                
                child = Node(state=child_belief, action=action, 
                           parent=node, G=G, depth=node.depth + 1)
                node.children.append(child)
                frontier.append(child)
                
                if G < best_G:
                    best_G = G
                    best_policy = self.extract_policy(child)
                    
        return best_policy
step_by_step_implementation.explanation: Tree search finds optimal policy by exploring action sequences

step_by_step_implementation.title: Monte Carlo Planner
step_by_step_implementation.description: Sample-based planning for continuous or large action spaces
step_by_step_implementation.code_snippet:
class MonteCarloPlanner:
    def __init__(self, model, num_samples=1000, horizon=20):
        self.model = model
        self.num_samples = num_samples
        self.horizon = horizon
        
    def plan(self, current_belief, goal_state=None):
        best_policy = None
        best_G = float('inf')
        
        for _ in range(self.num_samples):
            # Sample random policy
            policy = self.sample_policy()
            
            # Simulate trajectory
            G = self.evaluate_policy(policy, current_belief, goal_state)
            
            if G < best_G:
                best_G = G
                best_policy = policy
                
        return best_policy
        
    def evaluate_policy(self, policy, start_belief, goal_state):
        total_G = 0
        belief = start_belief.copy()
        
        for t in range(self.horizon):
            # Get action from policy
            action = policy.get_action(belief, t)
            
            # Simulate step
            next_state = self.model.step(belief, action)
            obs = self.model.observe(next_state)
            
            # Update belief
            belief = self.model.update_belief(belief, action, obs)
            
            # Compute expected free energy components
            pragmatic = self.pragmatic_value(belief, goal_state)
            epistemic = self.epistemic_value(belief)
            
            total_G += self.model.gamma**t * (pragmatic + epistemic)
            
        return total_G
step_by_step_implementation.explanation: Monte Carlo planning samples policies and evaluates them through simulation

step_by_step_implementation.title: Gradient-Based Planner
step_by_step_implementation.code_snippet:
class GradientPlanner:
    def __init__(self, model, policy_network, optimizer='adam'):
        self.model = model
        self.policy_network = policy_network
        self.optimizer = self.get_optimizer(optimizer)
        
    def optimize_policy(self, current_belief, goal_state, num_iterations=100):
        # Initialize policy parameters
        policy_params = self.policy_network.parameters()
        
        for iteration in range(num_iterations):
            # Compute expected free energy
            G = self.compute_expected_free_energy(policy_params, 
                                                current_belief, goal_state)
            
            # Compute gradients
            self.optimizer.zero_grad()
            G.backward()
            
            # Update policy
            self.optimizer.step()
            
        return self.policy_network
        
    def compute_expected_free_energy(self, policy_params, belief, goal):
        # Sample trajectories using current policy
        trajectories = self.sample_trajectories(policy_params, belief)
        
        # Compute expected free energy for each trajectory
        G_values = []
        for trajectory in trajectories:
            G = self.evaluate_trajectory(trajectory, goal)
            G_values.append(G)
            
        # Return expected value
        return torch.mean(torch.stack(G_values))
step_by_step_implementation.explanation: Gradient-based optimization of continuous policy parameters
